Never worry about who is going to play with whom or keep track of the points.
We provide you with three fun tournament types: Americano, Mix Americano, Team Americano!

HOW TO PLAY PADEL AMERICANO
Each player will play with the same partner only once in the entire tournament.
The score is obtained individually, even when playing as a team.

NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS
You can use our app no matter how many players you are playing. In contrast to other apps on the market, we have speciallized in creating a tournament generator that can handle low, high or uneven number of players.

NUMBERS OF COURTS NEEDED
As a general rule there should be one court for every 4 players.

THE SCORING SYSTEM
Based on a predetermined number of points per game (e.g. 21 points) the team that takes the most number of points will be the winner of the match. This also means that being the winner or loser of the match is irrelevant. The reason for this is that each point counts in your individual results. As a player you should always aim to get as many points as possible, it will not be the same to win 20 to 1 than 11 to 10.

HOW TO WIN IN AMERICANO
To become the winner of the Padel Americano you have to not only rely on your technical and tactical skills, but also a high level of adaption and coordination with your different teammates throughout the tournament.

This is the best app to track your climbing and boulder sessions automatically. Redpoint gives you detailed overview and feedback on your ascents.

Use your Apple Watch or iPhone as a fitness tracker for bouldering and climbing. Contribute your climbing session to closing your daily rings! Workouts are stored in HealthKit and therefore visible in the Health app and Workouts app as well.

After each session you will see detailed information about your climbs: the overall height, your heart rate, duration, maximum ascent height, ascending speed, difficulty of routes, and most importantly: Redpoint will give you personalized training suggestions based on that data. How to go from V4 to V5? Or from 5.11b to 5.11c? Redpoint creates a training plan just for you to achieve your next climbing goals.

So, how does that work?
Thanks to highly advanced machine learning we are able to classify climbing movements right on Apple Watch. In addition to that we use the built-in barometer to measure the ascended altitude. You can track the difficulty of ascended routes right from the Apple Watch.

Works For:

- Trad Climbing
